item.title: Bulk rubbish - Clarion Housing Ref CRM:0195700465, 13th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding the persistent and worsening issue of illegal dumping in our neighbourhood at SE20 8TA. The situation has reached an entirely unacceptable level. What should feel like a place to call home is increasingly resembling a dumping ground. Despite repeated concerns raised by myself and other members of the community to Clarion Housing Association, which manages the estate, no action has been taken. The continued build-up of waste is not only unsightly, but it also raises serious concerns about hygiene, safety, and the overall wellbeing of residents. It is deeply disheartening to see our shared environment neglected in this way. I urge you to visit the affected areas in person to fully grasp the extent of the problem. I am calling on the housing association or the council to take immediate and effective action, including: The prompt removal of all existing dumped items. Increased monitoring and enforcement in known hotspot areas. Clear and timely communication to residents outlining how this issue will be addressed in the long term. We deserve to live in a clean, safe, and respectful environment. I trust this matter will now be treated with the seriousness it warrants. Please provide a timeline for when specific actions will be taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35-85, Wadhurst Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding affecting crossing, 13th July
item.description:
This area of the road has once again flooded, leaving standing water regardless of the weather. This means that the pedestrian crossing is almost impossible to use and vehicles are changing lanes at very late notice to avoid splashing causing a risk of crashes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Manorway, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Human poo done outside flat intercom door, 13th July
item.description:
The whole block stinks of unpleasant human faeces. Someone has taken a dump outside the intercom door of flats 13-23 Hows street LONDON E2 8EE. Someone has deliberately done this and the whole block and quadrant stinks of unpleasant human poo.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hows Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Wooden Bollards in Rain Garden damaged, 13th July
item.description:
